title: Stock Market Indices Have Mixed Technical Picture
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DIA) sits alone under the 50-day moving average, while his friends, Russell 2000 (IWM), Nasdaq 100 (QQQ) and S&P500 (SPY) cleared Fridays highs and remain above their 50-day moving averages.  Though only the DIA ended under the 50-day moving average, it still had an inside day which shows digestion of […] The post Stock Market Indices Have Mixed Technical Picture appeared first on See It Market.

text: As the White House and Congressional Democrats press for a $1.9 trillion pandemic relief package that many Republicans say is more than what the country needs or can afford, Federal Reserve policymakers are also split on the issue.

title: Reddit's ‘epic' silver squeeze is only helping Wall Street
text: Finally, a “Reddit rally” Wall Street can get behind. The merry band of day traders behind runaway stocks like GameStop piled into silver on Monday in an effort to squeeze Wall Street.

title: U.S. housing market immune to COVID-19 pandemic: Reuters poll
text: U.S. house prices will continue to race ahead over the next two years, according to a Reuters poll of analysts who said any COVID-19 resurgence was unlikely to knock housing market activity off its current upward course.

title: New Shares Pumped

title: Major Asset Classes: January 2021 Performance Review
text: Stocks in emerging markets continued to lead the major asset classes in January as the top monthly performer. Emerging markets shares have been up for four straight months, pushing this slice of the world's equities to a wide one-year lead of nearly 28%.

title: U.S. House panel announces February 18 hearing on GameStop market volatility
text: The U.S. House of Representatives Financial Services Committee will hold a hearing on recent market volatility involving GameStop Corp and other stocks on Feb. 18, the committee said in a statement on Monday.

title: Stock futures open little changed after Wall Street's strong start to the week
text: U.S. stock futures were little changed on Monday evening after the equity market kicked off the week with a bounce-back session.

title: 'This Is Not The Market Participant's Problem': Volatility Arbitrage Trader Talks GameStop, Market Microstructure, Regulation
text: In 2019, former financial professional Keith Gill, who goes by “Roaring Kitty” on Reddit, began a movement that pushed GameStop Corporation's (NYSE: GME) stock price as high as $513.12 in premarket trade Jan. 28, after which numerous brokers made the controversial decision to limit trades, creating a synthetic imbalance that caused the stock to plummet to a low of $112.25 in regular trade. As part of the development, Benzinga chatted with Kris Sidial, a former institutional trader and the co-chief investment officer of The Ambrus Group, a volatility arbitrage fund that looks to exploit changing market structure dynamics.

title: The Dow Rose 229 Points Because Everything Went Right for Stocks

text: All anyone wants to talk about is "Gamestonk!" Can't really blame them, when a stock advances more than 16X in 12 sessions, it definitely gets your attention.

title: Junk Bonds Should Benefit from the Rally in Unloved Stocks. Investors Are Pulling Out Cash Anyway.
text: High-yield bonds are seeing outflows but not underperformance during the recent stock market volatility, a sign that junk bonds may continue to hold up despite concerns about risky markets.

title: Unpacking behavioral investing trends behind the Reddit-fueled trading frenzy

text: Omar Aguilar, Charles Schwab Investment Management, says he's noticed investors are now focusing more on long-term investments and have turned their attention back to earnings after the latest GameStop surge. He also discusses why tech is performing well.

title: The Fed: Economy still in ‘depths of recession,' Fed's Rosengren says
text: The U.S. economy is still in the depths of recession with high unemployment and many Americans still on temporary layoffs, said Boston Fed President Eric Rosengren on Monday.

title: Citi's Shafir: M&A Comeback Has Legs, SPACs Here to Stay
text: Feb.01 -- Mark Shafir, Citigroup's co-head of global M&A, discusses the outlook for M&A activity in 2021 and the "robust" use of special purpose acquisition companies (SPACs) for listings. He speaks with Bloomberg's Ed Hammond on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close.

title: Dow soars 229 points as stocks stage biggest rally in 12 weeks
text: The S&P 500 notched its biggest daily gain in 12 weeks on Monday after suffering from last week's 3% decline, which was its worst since October. Last week's volatility was driven by a number of short-squeezes in stocks that had been targeted by traders coordinating on Reddit's WallStreetBets forum, but JPMorgan said investors should take advantage of the decline and "buy the dip."

title: Stocks mount sharp bounceback as markets look to recover from GameStop frenzy
text: U.S. stocks ended sharply higher on Monday, led by gains in tech shares as investors looked to recover from last week's sharp losses sparked by wild trading in shares of videogame retailer GameStop Corp. and other small-cap companies. The S&P 500 rose 1.6% to 3,774.

title: Newton's First Law Of Motion
text: Economic and financial trends that have been in place for years and even decades oftentimes reverse with major catalysts. Since the bottom of the 2007-2009 financial crisis, the S&P 500's total return (appreciation plus reinvested dividends) through the end of 2020 is 607.9% while the MSCI World Excluding US Stock Index is up 267.4% and the MSCI Emerging Market Index is up 247.3%.

title: Here's What Could Spark The Next 10% Market Correction, Bank Of America Warns
text: Companies are no longer being rewarded by investors for blowout earnings–and that could spell trouble for stocks down the line.

title: The Tell: A ‘Dumb-Money Confidence' stock-market gauge is flashing a warning
text: A gauge of the confidence of individual investors, colloquially referred to as “dumb money,” was breaching a level at 0.67 that SentimenTrader's Jay Kaeppel deemed indicative of trouble for forward returns in the S&P 500 index.

title: Further GameStop Momentum Makes Russell Outperform, But Now Look Out For A Major Market Peak
text: The GME momentum higher will probably continue for some more days, even weeks. The Russell 2000 will continue to outperform in that case. This GME story is unlikely to morph into a Lehman style of market dislocation. More likely, some type of LCTM rescue/bail-out will be engineered by the Federal Reserve.

title: Billionaire Tom Steyer weighs in on Reddit-fueled market volatility

title: Two Kinds Of Short Squeezes – Reddit Squeezing Stocks And Central Banks Squeezing Bonds
text: The stock market short squeeze orchestrated by Redditers is related to the bond market short squeeze orchestrated by global central banks.

title: Economic Report: Treasury slashes borrowing estimates for first three months of 2021
text: The Treasury Department said Monday it expects to borrow $274 billion in the first quarter, which is $853 billion lower than previously estimated.

title: Carson Block Says Financial Markets Are Broken
text: Feb.01 -- Carson Block, Muddy Waters Capital LLC chief executive officer, rejects the idea that he is part of the financial "establishment" and calls for more enforcement from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission in the wake of the GameStop Corp. frenzy. He speaks with Bloomberg's Erik Schatzker on "Bloomberg Markets.

title: What Happens When The Game Stops?
text: Valuations are stretched, but speculative option trading may not necessarily be a sign of widespread, unsustainable froth. Reports indicate that single-stock option trading has been smashing single-day volume records during January.

title: SEC could set short interest caps, hike trading taxes to combat wild moves, analysts say
text: The SEC could cap short interest on specific securities or aggressively tax short-term trading, according to Bank of America Merrill Lynch.

title: GameStop And Reddit's Organized Trading Could Spark A Stock Market Bloodbath
text: GameStop could be just the beginning. Reddit traders are plotting new “attacks” on the stock market.

title: Cantor Fitzgerald CEO Says SPACs Have Democratized IPO Market
text: Feb.01 -- Cantor Fitzgerald Chairman and CEO Howard Lutnick says special purpose acquisition companies are filling a "gap" for investors between the initial public offering and private equity markets. "SPACs are here to stay, they fill that void," Lutnick says on "Bloomberg Markets.

title: US Markets Begin February Significantly Overvalued
text: On Feb. 1, Berkshire Hathaway Inc. (NYSE:BRK.A)(NYSE:BRK.B) CEO Warren Buffett (Trades, Portfolio)'s favorite market indicator stood at 139.8%, up approximately 4.7% from the Jan. 4 reading of 135.1%.
